Posts.Content: Hi, I was fine about mine. I had a double mx with implants. I was just pleased the devil out. The staff were lovely and I was relieved.
Posts.Title: Why am I not nervous

Posts.Content: Thank you for your kind words, I am struggling but when do I return to work
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: No I haven't, I've just found out that I need a full mastectomy with replacement s . Just not sure how I feel about it.
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: I've been diagnosed with invasive lobular cancer which is ER8,PR7 and HER awaited. I have no idea what it all means, can someone help please?
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: Ok I'm 52, have ER8,PR7 and and HER awaited. I've had 2 MRI s and two biopsies so far. If the second biopsy is ok I'm hoping to have surgery on Thursday , if they have found another calcification on my other boob I've got another MRI and biopsy this weekend. Every time I seem to know what's happening things go wrong. Terrrified -yes; I'm just recovering from spinal surgery and the MRIs give me panic attacks. Sorry
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: Thanks for you info Jo, I was told (at the beginning) that they didn't think I would need chemo, now I have no idea at all. I'm hoping to find out if my surgery is on for Thursday , if it is I would be so happy.
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: Thank you for your kind words, I will feel better when I know exactly what's happening.  I know I will have to check for the rest of my life but I'm hoping apart from that I will get a life
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: Susie your words are really helpful.  Thank you x
Posts.Title: I don't quite understand

Posts.Content: I’m 8 weeks post chemo and my joints ache,even when I’ve been going to the gym! I’ve been on letrozole for two days and the pain is terrible.  Any suggestions?
Posts.Title: Post chemo

Posts.Content: So next week I'll be getting ready for a double mastectomy. I've been told I don't carry enough fat to use and I'm getting implants with mesh? Not quite sure about all that. What type and which are the best? And how long is the recovery? I love the gym but after having my lymph nodes removed 3 days ago I'm swollen and sore, any ideas or suggestions would be great.  Thanks friends x
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks I was worried about implants , what type did you have? Are there different types? I'm told the mesh is really good
Posts.Title: Implants after mastectomy

Posts.Content: so had my mx and nodes done. Thought I was having radiotherapy but been told now chemo. My margins are 4 and 8? What kind of chemo do you get for that? And do you really need chemo?
Posts.Title: Margins and chemo

Posts.Content: I also think this site is really handy when you don't understand stuff, there seems to be someone who has an answer . I find that brilliant. Like you I try to be upbeat all the time , I find it's the not knowing which causes me upset .
Posts.Title: Abnormal lack of feelings?

Posts.Content: so after finding I've breast cancer in one and now invasive lobular in the other, had 11 nodes taken, 1 had a trace and a double mx later. I've been told I will need chemo, any advice on any of this cos I'm terrified and thought once my cancer had gone , that's it!
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: I had clear nodes one side and 1 out of 7 on other side. I was told micro amount. Not sure about margins but I was told 8 one side and 4 the other. I don't really understand it all.
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: I hate to upset you, but I was told that but then they changed their minds. I can cope with loads but I need to know how, when, why so I can sort out my own mind
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: I was told I'd only need radiotherapy at first but when I saw Dr on Friday, he said that oncologist had said chemo. I think that's why I'm confused!
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Daydream47 Hi sasha have you decided for or against chemo yet and what is the benifits to having it against risks ?  I don't see oncologist until Friday lunchtime. But I'll let you know when I find out
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for your input, after having all cancer removed I was going for a small amount of chemo as I'm desperate to return to work
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hello ladies, don't be afraid of chemo. I'm on fec-t and have done 2 already and yes I still have my hair! I've used the cold cap and it works!!!! Ok you'll get hair thinning but it's doable and I've not bothered with a wig cos I've got one more session of fec and then I've heard your hair starts to grow back. Good luck , drink loads of water, eat your greens and get some exercise it's really been ok for me x
Posts.Title: Starting chemo!!

Posts.Content: Thanks Carolyn, I'm HER2- in one but invasive lobular in the other. I'm seeing the oncologist on Friday so maybe he can explain it more
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm HER--- , not positive and have been told I will respond to a hormone drug . It's the invasive lobular which seems to be a problem
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: I know that if they say you need it, I will do it
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular and chemo

Posts.Content: Hello ladies, don't be afraid of chemo. I'm on fec-t and have done 2 already and yes I still have my hair! I've used the cold cap and it works!!!! Ok you'll get hair thinning but it's doable and I've not bothered with a wig cos I've got one more session of fec and then I've heard your hair starts to grow back. Good luck , drink loads of water, eat your greens and get some exercise it's really been ok for me x
Posts.Title: Starting chemo!!

Posts.Content: My bcn said that I was going to have  Gabapentin for pain relief.  Has any one else had it?
Posts.Title: Docetaxol and Clexane

Posts.Content: I totally agree and I'm using the cold cap and have hopefully retained some of mine!
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Thanks for the positive comment, I've had the fec quite easily I think. Did you have to take 8 steroids the day before, did three days? I'm sure the steroids irritate my sleeping and me!
Posts.Title: Truth about doxetaxel

Posts.Content: Ok I know everyone is different but what is the truth!  I've heard that once you start the T of fec-t your hair starts growing, truth or lie? The pain is so unbearable in your joints?  The pain starts 5 days after chemo? Gabapentin for pain relief, or not. You will have massive weight gain cos of steroids? I'm about to start it and what is the truth, I'm so petrified before I start.
Posts.Title: Truth about doxetaxel

Posts.Content: Thanks for your input. Having only 4 steroids for 3 days makes me hyper so I really don't want 8 a day! I just wondered if anyone had got out of having them at all.  Looks like I'm stuffed!
Posts.Title: Truth about doxetaxel

Posts.Content: hi ladies, I'm sure I'm not the only one who's had implants due to mastectomy!  But are you allowed to wear underwired bras after you've had implants?  I find the soft bras ok but want to make 'my new additions' stand proud again.  Any suggestions?
Posts.Title: Bras and implants

Posts.Content: last Friday I saw my specialist who said I was " cancer free " but would need some radiotherapy. Just had a call to say he needs to discuss my results and check my wounds. He did that last Friday so I'm now shit scared ! Has the cancer spread? Help
Posts.Title: Now I'm really worried

Posts.Content: Thanks Gay, I had mine done in June, so I'll wait until Xmas . I must admit the soft bras are nice but I want to feel like a woman again!
Posts.Title: Bras and implants

Posts.Content: Thanks Julia, I've phoned back and left a message for them to contact me. He went through results and I said, does that mean I'm cancer free. He said yes but you'll need radiotherapy and he said he'd sent off results to check for something. Maybe he's found something
Posts.Title: Now I'm really worried

Posts.Content: Nor did mine until today
Posts.Title: Now I'm really worried

Posts.Content: Hey it's absolutely fine. I was like that! Had a terrible headache/ hangover feeling for the rest of the day, then the following day had a nausea pill in the morning but was fine all day, just tired by the evening. Keep going it's doable and stay positive. Don't let it beat you !
Posts.Title: Am i feeling too normal?

Posts.Content: so I finished my chemo 5 weeks ago but my hair is still thinning! How long does it keep thinning? I’ll soon be bald! HELP ME
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair falling out with cold cap

Posts.Content: Yes please do it works for me. Brain freeze for 10 mins then goes.  I've just had my second fec and still got my hair, it is thinner but it's there
Posts.Title: Am i feeling too normal?

Posts.Content: Hi, like you I had my first fec and apart from a hangover on the day( due to cold cap) I felt fine , just a bit tired. I've got my 2nd this week and am worried it's going to be terrible but people have said the first is the worse! So stay positive, I want it finished but it's only 4 more sessions after this one
Posts.Title: Am i feeling too normal?

Posts.Content: Thanks for your info. I finished treatment 5 weeks ago but my hair is still thinning! It’s started to grow where I was bald but the rest still keeps falling out!  It’s just getting to me
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair falling out with cold cap

Posts.Content: Thanks Sammy, did you use the cold cap too?
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair falling out with cold cap

Posts.Content: I've been told I'm going to get abraxane instead of docetaxel for my T bit of fec-t. My question is does the cold cap work if you have this drug? I've loooked on the Macmillen website but it does not mention the cold cap and if it works. I've been using the cold cap through my chemo and have kept my hair even though its thin. Can someone help me on this because I'm not prepared to loose my hair after getting so far. Macmillan your website does not help!
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair loss with cold cap

Posts.Content: Thanks Rach, that sounds really positive. I'm usually ok, I suppose it's ok to wobble now and again. So thanks again for you info and support x
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair loss with cold cap

Posts.Content: Thank you, I'm sitting here waiting for it to start. Hubby gone to work, as tears are rolling down my face. I'm not sure why? I just want it all to be over. I'm sure it's destroying my marriage too. Sorry to moan but thanks for listening.x
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair loss with cold cap

Posts.Content: Thanks hoperu. I'm usually so positive, I've just finished my chemo and now will just chill to hubby gets home tonight. Good luck with your fec-t. Eat whole foods, cut processed and do loads of exercise even if it's just walking. Like you I had double mx then chemo. It is all doable
Posts.Title: Abraxane and hair loss with cold cap

Posts.Content: I've had a double mx, nodes removed and find out tomorrow what my results are. I'm absolutely terrified that I might have to have chemo. But how much chemo do you need if only two nodes out of 7 are cancerous? If anyone has a similar situation or can advise me I'd be very grateful.
Posts.Title: Results end chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you. I've not really got a nurse cos I had my mx in London but see my Dr in north Essex. I just don't understand it all and I'm terrified of loosing my hair
Posts.Title: Results end chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you that speech is amazing, just what I needed to hear.  Like everyone else we all worry and get scared, so now I need to stand strong and just do it. X
Posts.Title: Results end chemo

Posts.Content: I'd like to know that too. I've had a double mx with implants.  How can they test you to see if anything has returned?
Posts.Title: Mama gram after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Maplin, I’ve just had my last chemo today. So hopefully I’ve just got to leave my hair alone for three/four weeks and the thinning might stop
Posts.Title: Hair or no hair ,

Posts.Content: I don’t get it , I’ve used the cold cap during my fec-t. First 4 hardly any hair loss or not enough to cause upset but since my 5 session I’ve lost half my hair ! Why now? I had abraxane cos I reacted with steroids but it’s still a taxane. Any suggestions? I wear hair bands when I go out and only brush once a day. Wash every 7-10 days . It’s really getting me down and tomorrow is my last chemo. Help
Posts.Title: Hair or no hair ,

Posts.Content: Thanks for your positive info. I'm a HLTA and I can't think I will be allowed back either. I want to be positive, go to the gym extra but would really gain from having a friend to go through it with( same condition as me) but at the mo I feel alone. I'm getting my long hair cut and I'm going to ask for the cold cap too, but also get a wig.  Thanks again x
Posts.Title: Positive FeC-T , or is it all bad

Posts.Content: Thanks Caroline , I'm hoping to sail through too. I love my gym and walking as that's all I seem to have control off! Did you put on much weight? Everyone seems to put on loads of weight and it really bothers me!
Posts.Title: Positive FeC-T , or is it all bad

Posts.Content: You are an Angel! Your words are so comforting to me, after having lymph nodes removed today, I can move my arms quite easily and have been told I will need 2-4 days in hospital after my double mastectomy. I'm just worried about my lymph results; it's been a rough time. Every time I think it can't get any worse it has.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy,

Posts.Content: i start my FEC-T in a couple of weeks and all I've heard is bad results! My oncologist tells me I won't gain weight on the steroids and I could maybe go to work but all I hear is negativity. I'm sure it is hard but is it really that bad?
Posts.Title: Positive FeC-T , or is it all bad

Posts.Content: Reading your post what is T and what is AC as I've got oncologist on Friday and I too don't want to loose my hair
Posts.Title: TAC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Last night I found out I need a full mastectomy with implants( sorry I can't remember correct words) I'm having lymph nodes removed tomorrow. Ladies how does it make you feel and how long is the recovery honestly?
Posts.Title: Mastectomy,

Posts.Content: I'm not trying to worry you but I had a small lump on one breast and calcification in my other. It turned out to be bad, then had a full mx. I'm now clear and waiting for chemo.
